bibl.title: Letter from John R. Kissinger to Jennie Wilson, January 30, 1907

div1.p: Kissinger provides Wilson with his address and relates his circumstances.

div1.head: Letter from John R. Kissinger to Jennie Wilson, January 30, 1907
div1.opener:
(1)
January 30 1907 South Bend Ind
Miss Jennie Wilson
Dear Friend
div1.p:
You may think me
not very prompt in answer-
-ing your letter whitch was
I rec,d several days ago
was suprised to hear
from you but very glad
and all so many thank
for sending me that
paper we showed it
to the Doctor the next
day after we got it and
he wanted it to read
and he allso knew the
writer I let him have
(2)
it he lade it down on
your letter when he started
away he took letters and
all he has forgotten it
ever time he come that
one reasion I have not
wrighten son,er,

I have been geting
along very nicely up to
the last two weeks
then I started to go down
agan I had been helping
a quite abit aboutght the
house, but yesterday
he told me I had to
stop doing a thing now
I will have to set around
and look out of the window
(3)
it make it rether bad
for me for I would like
to be up and doinng

One thing it keep us
a thinking to make both
end meet we have keept
out of dept so far.

Ida (my wife) has not been
felling the best for quite
awhile we have been
doing a number of washing,
I set on chair that was
fick up with cushions and I
would rubb and ring
about all of them but
now it throught it
all on her to do.

I was tell her I
4
had not ought to compl
and when I have only
been 5 month since
I stop walking and
you have been all your
life

This is a beaughtfuly
days and not quit so
cold we had ought to
be very thankful for
not having any more cold
weather this winter then
what we have had,

I was glad to hear
that the Ullerys were
all well at the date of
your letter. we send
our best regards to
5
them

Some one I think it
was Howard. R. or Will. R.
sent me 5 rabbets I re-
ceived them day befor
yesterday I want to
tell you they were good

I will have to close
for I dont if you can
read this or not for
the miss spelt words
for I have not rote a
half doz, letter in 3 years

I leve it all to my
wife,
div1.closer:
so with best regards
I remain your Friend John R Kissinger over
Ac
Ki
Best wishes from my
wife to all
606 E Keasey St
South Bend
Ind,
